titleStmt.title: URFA-014
SHAWI Corpus
titleStmt.funder: Funded by the FWF Austrian Science Fund under the number P 33574

publicationStmt.distributor: Austrian Center for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.

spanGrp.span: We have here a word they say “the ´valley´ that cuts all the valleys”. This is the son of the son of a leader (someone, who has a high social status in the village?) ---, he is the son of the leader and he is angry with his father.
He picks up his house and comes to another place, where there were other Arabs. When he arrives there, he installs his house and the tent. Thus, he pulls the tent on the leader’s tent.

I mean, the house, when it gets set up – does not it have a (maras: column/rope?) They pull the house using the maras. He pulled his maras on the leader’s maras, to whom he has recently come. This (move) means, that I have nothing.
I am hungry. The leader of the new place comes to him, feels sorry for him and sends him a tray. I mean like wheat, flour, ghee..etc This (the newcomer) becomes a coffee man for this leader

At night he sings ˁatāba (which is a traditional Arabic musical form improvised by a solo poet singer) in which he claims that he is also son of a leader. The leader hears him and speaks with him: “I heard you singing ˁatāba, and your ˁatāba” ˗˗ You know what the ˁatāba is, right?
“It seems like you made yourself a leader in your ˁatāba. If you are like what you sang about, then you have my respect (on my head). If you are lying, I will kill you.
I will send now my men to your family to see if you are really son of a leader or not”

He says: “Yes, go to my familly, but I beg you not to go to my uncle Wādi” He says: “why?” He answers: “My uncle Wādi is a weak man. He has nothing. But if you want to go to my father and my other uncles, go ahead!”

While they are on their way they say suddenly: “Let’s pass by his uncle Wādi and see, how he is!” When they arrived to his uncle’s place, they saw how the animals were being slaughtered one after another and served to the guests. I mean

When they saw his uncle Wādi, they said: “This is even the poor one (let alone the other uncles). Let’s go back, guys. Wādi cuts all the valleys (He cuts the doubt/ He is a proof?)” They go back to him, he asks: “How was it?” They say: “As he says, all good (that he is a son of a leader)” One day the leader receives a present; a falcon. By the way the Arabs fall for falcons

When he receives the falcon he says to him: “Tell us, how is this falcon?” He says: “Sir, this is really a falcon, a white falcon, but it is descended from chicken’’ He says: “How is that?” He says: “It is descended from chicken” He says: “Fine!” After he receives three camels he says: “Figure it out for us, which one is the mother and which one is the grandmother”

He says: “Let them become thirsty and then bring them to the basin, to the water!” After they brought them, he said: “This one is the mother, this one is the daughter and this one is the grandmother” He figured it out, all of them.

Then he says to him: “Tell us, how did you know that the falcon was a descended from chicken?” He (the leader) went and asked its keeper. He said: “It is true!” He says: “This falcon goes to the misčæne (the place, where animals eat and defecate in the yard?) and soaks himself in it.”

He says: “If his mother raised him free (as a falcon), he wouldn’t have gone to the misčæne and soaked himself in it” There is a meaning for it. He says: “And these here, how did you figure out the camels?” He says: “The camels let (usually) the youngest one drink first’’ He says: “As long as you know so much,

why don’t you tell me what kind of a man I am? ” The leader asking that himself. He says: “Sir, (It is known about you that) you are a sheikh (a presidental title among bedouins), your father is a sheikh. You are the son of that and that and your grandfather is that”

He goes on: “(However) No, that is not true. Do you promise by God that you will not do anything to me?” He says: “I will not do anything to you (I will not say anything to you)” He says: “Sir, you are son of a hawker though. You are not son of a leader” He says: “How?” He says: “Go and ask your mother!” He goes to his mother
“Mom, whose son am I?” She says: “Mine. Your father is a leader so-and-so.” He says: “No, you either tell me the truth or I will kill you!” He scared her. He says: “Tell me, who is my father?”
She says: “Honestly; my son; your father can not have children. One day a hawker came to us and slept with me in order for your father to have a son” ˗˗ She fornicated with him

He came back to him and said: “You know what, you are telling the truth. I am son of a hawker. I have asked my mother, and she said to me; your father is a hawker. But tell me, how did you know that I am son of a hawker?”
He says: “Sir, when I quarreled with my father and came to you, I set up my tent next to yours. What did I mean by that? I meant that I had nothing. Look how high is your acuity?

If I gathered a goat or a sheep from each house, I would have ended up having fourty to fivety sheep, so I wouldn’t have any needs anymore. But you gave me a tray, and the tray is something a hawker would give!”
